title: Major flaw in solenoid alarm
text: Had a false trust in their solenoid alarm. It is designed to monitor the AC current with some high and low threshold that isn‚Äôt settable. If the current exceed 800mA it assumes you have some sort of short. If it is at 0 it assumes you have an open. If it is anywhere between that it assumes all is well.  It all seems to be based on a single zone/ relay install. This is great in that situation as if there is a problem you are informed. However, many irrigation systems have an irrigation pump which is controlled via the MV relay. While you have to program this MV relay and the report says there are two solenoids, the solenoid current monitoring alarm is totally oblivious to the fact there are two relays. So if a zone opens from a fault there is still current going to the MV relay and still turns the pump on. The controller thinks all is fine as the current isn‚Äôt 0. Now the pump is pumping water but there is nowhere to send the water. After about a month of this I noticed my grass dying. Went to investigate and my pump melted and so did the PVC pipe. $1000 in repairs.  If only it knew what the MV current rating was or if it monitored the actual current versus the average over the last 10 runs it would easily shut of and given me an alarm.  So all this intelligence and it failed to do one of the basic of intelligence.

My water usage grew dramatically last month (based on my water bill) - I didn‚Äôt have insight into that. Perhaps I‚Äôll add a flow meter, but out of the box I‚Äôm not seeing something like ‚Äútotal minutes programmed per day‚Äù or something that would give me a sense of what I‚Äôve programmed over time and to make sure I did not cross my wires among all the levels of set up. But this app doesn‚Äôt know. 

The app itself is bad. It‚Äôs clearly a web app ported to mobile. As a result, its touch responsiveness is bad and it feels slow. Page transitions are terrible. 

It‚Äôs missing major features. Once a program starts, I cannot stop the whole program. I often need to do that because it‚Äôs running while it‚Äôs raining. The only thing you can do is stop an individual zone once it has started. So, I need to check back with the app every 20mins and stop each zone as it starts. Ridiculous. 

A smart sprinkler system is about good software. Clearly Hunter doesn‚Äôt agree and just assumes their distributors will sell whatever product they provide, even when the software is clearly sub par.

title: Useful but needs improvement ...
text: I really like the idea of this app, The predictive watering all but eliminates the need for a rain sensor ... this alone makes the Hydrawise worthy of keeping. However, it could use one major improvement to make it more customizable and user friendly.  With its current settings, to run multiple programs at different times/days during the week, and for different durations, you have to stack programs ... or use the remote function to adjust the duration and zones to water, but the remote function has to be set manually each time and can‚Äôt be set as a recurring program. The Preconfigured Program in the app defaults to your original watering duration time, in this case we‚Äôll use 30 min, which it won‚Äôt let you adjust.  To run a second program with a different duration you have to ‚Äústack‚Äù programs. An example of stacking would be if your normal watering time is 30 minutes at 7am, but you also wanted to syringe (spray or cool down) your lawn for 5 minutes at 4pm during the summer months ... the preconfigured watering program is almost useless in my opinion. To set up this program so you could syringe for 5 minutes, you would have to stack your main programs in 5 minute increments i.e. 7:00-7:05, 7:05-7:10, 7:10-7:15, 7:15-7:20, 7:20-7:25, 7:25-7:30, then you could set a schedule for syringing for 5 minutes at 4pm ... because now your main watering time is 5 minutes. Now imagine doing that for multiple zones .... and by the way, these are the instructions that Hunter has on their site!!  With the state of technology today, and all of the great, fantastical, and mind boggling things we can do with it, I only have one question .... why, why, why, why, and why???  I guess I‚Äôm just having a hard time trying to understand why I can‚Äôt go in and set up a 2nd, 3rd, 4th program etc, at the time of my choosing, for the duration of my choosing, on the days of my choosing, without having to jump through all these hoops, and stacking programs, to get it done?  This seems like it should be a fairly easy update to add .... shouldn‚Äôt it?  Having to make all of these ridiculous work arounds to do something so simple rates a 3 Star review, bordering on 2 stars ... with a couple of tweaks though, this could easily be a 5 Star review and a 5 Star app.

title: Relatively good app
text:
I‚Äôve been using this app off and on (mostly off) for over a year now.  The app is fairly intelligent as it integrates with external sources to provide predictive watering which is really nice - helps minimize water usage.  In terms of ‚Äúusability‚Äù, The scheduling functionality is relatively simple although I am a really infrequent user and when I have had to go back in and tweak the schedule, it takes me time fumble around with the controls on the screen (drop down lists, etc).  Some appear disabled (greyed out) even though they are enabled, etc. If the scheduling was a bit more graphical, that would be beneficial.  In any case, it‚Äôs still fairly usable for an infrequent user.  

The one big thing I don‚Äôt like about this application is the manual login.  I should be able to authenticate using my fingerprint.  But, I don‚Äôt see that as an option and, is also the reason why I have been mostly ‚Äúoff‚Äù than on.  I forgot my password finally only after a few months got time to change my password and log back in.  You build a great app, but if it‚Äôs pain in the neck to get into, chances are you won‚Äôt use it to its maximum benefit.

title: Lots of Promise, yet Inconsistent Results
text:
As a long time fan of Hunter Industries, we install this controller for every new installation we provide. The efficiency is great. For the most part, the features provided by the software are far more useful that the competition.

With that said, there are several issues we continually deal with. iPhone 7+ and other devices will not load the app with notifications turned off. Tech support could not help and it is a continual issue. Notifications are off due to the issues with the proprietary flow sensor that gives false readings and we have had failures ever since we started installing them. We constantly get false alerts to leaks and waste time on service calls that are not there. But on the flip side, if there is a true leak, when don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs accurate and what‚Äôs not.

Over all there is good promise with this app. The UI and UX needs a major overhaul. Notifications need to be fixed. And The Flow sensor errors need to be addressed as well. That could just be a hardware related issue.

Other than those continual issues, in my professional opinion, this is a reliable and useful option for any true professional.

title: Best Wi-Fi Sprinkler
text:
Researched many different companies and decided to go with Hydrawise.  It was easy to order and arrived quickly.  I had some issue with connecting to my wi-fi network but customer support resolved quickly and were very helpful.

Thus far I am very pleased with purchase.  The only downside is that it doesn't offer auto adjustments for rainfall unless you pay $60 a year.  For those of us that only water a max of 6 months a year it seems unlikely you can recoup that cost in water savings.  So now I have to manually delay but now I can do that even when I am away from home.

The auto adjustments for temperature and the ability to manually run while out in the yard and see actual watering time for week are invaluable.

title: Best App I've Used In A Long Time!!!
text:
I have been searching for an automated sprinkler system for years.  This system and app is the best out there by far.   Within 10 minutes I unscrewed my old wires from the controller and screwed them back again into the Hydrawise unit.   I entered my wireless password and I was up and running.  I can walk around my yard and test the zones and sprinkler heads.  I can also get very sophisticated on how and when the system goes off based on the local weather and other factors.   

Download the trial and check it out.  It works EXACTLY as it says on the web site and EXACTLY how the trial works.  It's refreshing to spend money and have zero regrets.  Congrats Hydrawise!

title: Great Controller and App
text: The Pro-HC controller has been exactly what we wanted in a residential controller with WIFI. Installation and setup was simple and has great connection to our router without slowing down our WIFI speed. The Hydrawise App is simple to use for setting up zones and preconfigured watering schedules. Having the app on my phone while installing or adjusting irrigation makes my life so easy instead of walking back and forth to the valves or the controller on the opposite side of the property, while responding very quickly through the App with little to no wait time. I would highly recommend this controller to anyone looking for a residential or small commercial project.

When you type into the app, say changing the minutes to run a zone, it is not very responsive in terms of punching in the numbers. You have to keep pressing for it to register. In addition, there is no BACK button in this app. So you can‚Äôt just easily go in and out of different portions of the app. One more thing, for the iPhone X, the display of the buttons at the bottom of the screen are somewhat cut off at the ends and also in the middle with a little black line.

title: I can actually see what my controller is doing
text: Change is tough especially when it comes to electronics but now that devices and platforms like Hydrawise are here, we can actually see how much water we are using and make changes to our sprinkler controllers from anywhere we have access to the internet. Thank you Hunter and Hydrawise for providing the most flexible and easy to manage platform on the market. Now we can actually manage our clients sprinkler timers and troubleshoot their problems remotely. The ability to print out reports to show clients their water usage is amazing and the ability to connect a flow meter to the controller is brilliant.

It takes a little knowledge to set the correct watering triggers. Anyone who gives it a bad review doesn‚Äôt know how to set up the app correctly. title: Seems good, a few issues
text:
I can't compare this to other online irrigation control systems, but this one is the one our installation company uses, and it seems fine.  There are all kinds of different settings you can adjust, which is great.

My only two nitpicks:

First, some of the settings are difficult to understand, for the consumer.

Second, the "Observations" panel on the Dashboard seems to be broken: it's blank where it should show current temperature and rainfall.

Third, the system needs better information about rainfall, closer to real time.  I paid extra for this to avoid those embarrassing moments when the sprinklers are on in the middle of a rain storm.  But that literally happened last night.  For whatever reason, the information that we were being literally deluged with rain didn't make it to the system, so the sprinklers turned on during the storm.

title: Get a Hunter Hydrawise controller!
text:
I‚Äôve tried Rachio and Rainbird‚Äôs apps for their WiFi controllers and Hunter has nailed it. I also love that Hydrawise is available as a desktop website as well. 

The reports are fantastic:
Weather forecasts and historical weather data. 
Weather station based watering triggers are saving me a lot of money on my water bill while keeping my landscaping looking great. 
I can see when my system will not run due to forecasted weather triggers. 

Everything I need from a smart controller app is in Hydrawise. Plus, if I ever have any questions about my controller or app, Hunter has free technical support that can view activities in my controller log. This helps in correcting any mistakes I may have made to my programming or adjustments. 

Get a Hunter Hydrawise controller and the Hydrawise app, you‚Äôll love it.

text:

Wanted to get this to the point that it was useful, but my invested time was rewarded with increasing frustration. 

Things you can't do: 1. Set a zone for every other day (only Even or Odd, with no adjustment for 31 day months), 2. Suspend just the next watering - 24 hours is minimum, 3. Override a bad weather forecast - my local station kept predicting 30-40 mph winds when we just had gentle breezes, 4.  Water based on High and Low temps for the day - it kept skipping early AM grass zone because the temp was low at 5:30 am, but was headed for the 90's. 

Just scratching the surface. My contractor specified this, I may bite the bullet and replace Hunter controller at my own additional expense. 

"Loading awesomeness ..." is the greeting. More like awfulness.

title: Pain in the butt to use
text:
Using this with a new irrigation install. This app is a pain in the butt to use. While it is neat to run the sprinklers at the tap of the phone screen, it takes 15 minutes to remember where I go to even shut the sprinkler off when I don‚Äôt want it to run. I‚Äôd rather have a basic non-WiFi box like my last house. 

The KISS principle would help wonders!

title: Our 2nd yr using this app with the Hunter WiFi Controller
text:
Overall I like this app as it enables me to adjust watering schedules to separate zones even when we‚Äôre out of town. 
I‚Äôve set up weather stations in our area and a virtual weather station at our home and our irrigation runs based on the weather reports averaged between the stations. We do pay a yearly fee to allow us to use more weather stations but it‚Äôs worth it to us. 
The setup for basic watering using multiple zones is fairly painless.
However setting up the parameters for current weather information from weather stations to control irrigation is a bit more complicated. 
The complication arises from the fact that you cannot see both the page you‚Äôre working on and the instructions at the same time. 
Using screen shots of the instructions on my iPhone and the setup page on my iPad made the process somewhat simpler.
The one complaint I have is user support: 
Typing into the help screen is a joke, I find it almost impossible to correct typos as there seems to be no back function, no way to use the curser for correction and sometimes it freezes up completely and I have to close then reopen the app and begin again. 
That‚Äôs all very frustrating but that‚Äôs not the worst!
On 09/05/19 I was finally able to send a coherent message about using the run time calculator, which requires setting up a separate account. 
I had numerous times attempted to set up that account but the program would recognize neither the username nor the password I‚Äôd set up when I tried to log in. 
After numerous attempts I send an email  about this problem giving the information about the app not recognizing the username or password. 
I was told I needed to set up a separate account...... really? 
I replied that I was aware of that and explained again what the issue was and in next email I received I was asked had I tried to use the ‚Äúforgot Password‚Äù option.
I affirmed I had but since the program did not recognize my username that was useless. 
On 09/06/19 I received a reply stating that the gentleman I was corresponding with would contact a rep who could assist me with this issue....... to date I have had no reply. 
I did receive another email on 09/07 asking what I thought of the customer service I received...... I only wish there had been an option other than ‚ÄúGood, I‚Äôm satisfied‚Äù and ‚ÄúBad, I‚Äôm unsatisfied‚Äù...... I checked ‚ÄúBad‚Äù but again have had no reply.
It appears to me that customer service here is rather nonexistent.
UPDATE 05/15/2020
Clearly no one at Hunter cares about customer issues or reads these reviews. 
I have yet to receive a reply from anyone at Hunter for my September 2019 issue. 
If I hadn‚Äôt already bought the Hunter WiFi controller and gone to the trouble of setting up this app I would probably look for something else to use. 
That‚Äôs sad because this app has such great potential for homeowners who care about their landscaping!

title: Took something that should be very simple and reeeeallly effed it up.
text:
How frustrating. Not sure how many updates there have been but both iOS and Android versions now have THE BUGGIEST tap-to-fill-fields and even the ‚ÄúNext‚Äù buttons and pull down menus are hinky. 

What should be a delight to use just keeps getting worse. :( Get it together Hunter.

title: Best wifi controller on the market!
text:
I have tried several WiFi enabled controllers, Hydrawise by far is the most complete and intuitive sprinkler controller on the market! Very simple to set up as it walks you through step by step. 

I did install a flow sensor that works incredible! This Hydrawise controller has so many features compared to others. I am able to program from the controller, has predictive watering, monitors electrical current and also monitors flow to alert you if there is an electrical issue or broken water lines. The other controllers I have tried are not capable of these items. It also works with Amazon Alexa!

 Rain bird WiFi controller is only app based not web based so, zero control on others devices such as tablet or PC. The weather pulls from a zip code so it‚Äôs not very accurate with the weather and adjusting the schedule. Because it‚Äôs app based, if you loose your phone you have to reprogram all zones with your phone. 

Rachio controller is okay but must be programmed with the phone. No walking up to the controller to start a zone. 

Hydrawise by far is hands down the  best WiFi controller on the market!
